title: Launsh Configuration
description: Defines the structure of the launsh.json configuration file for the launsh application. This schema describes how to declare entrypoints that launch scripts or commands, including their arguments, environment variables, and output redirection. Each entrypoint must specify at least a 'program' to execute. See each property for details.

entrypoints.description: A mapping of entrypoint names to their execution definitions. Each key is a unique entrypoint name, and each value describes how to run that entrypoint.

description.description: A human-readable summary of what this entrypoint does.

program.description: The executable or script to run for this entrypoint. This is required.

args.description: A list of command-line arguments to pass to the program for this entrypoint.

stdout.description: If specified, standard output will be redirected to this file path for this entrypoint.

stderr.description: If specified, standard error will be redirected to this file path for this entrypoint.

environment.description: A mapping of environment variable names to their values for this entrypoint.

parameter.description: A list of parameter names that can be used in environment variables for this entrypoint.
